item.description:
Join us in May for our first “Meet the Author” Meetup! We'll meet with local author Phoebe Baker Hyde and discuss her new book, The Beauty Experiment: How I Skipped Lipstick, Ditched Fashion, Faced the World without Concealer, and Learned to Love the Real Me. The book has been stirring up some controversy and media interest and has been featured by The New York Post, Yahoo, The Boston Globe and Katie Couric. Phoebe will give a short talk, moderate the discussion, and answer questions. Should be a fun and enlightening evening!

Below is a description of the book by an Amazon reviewer:

Baker-Hyde's book is lovely to read, self-reflective and perceptive. She offers a model of feminism that is not self-consciously so, but is rather a search for self, with awareness of how femininity is sold to women in the guise of products and habits that can become all-engulfing and inspire purposeless, unachievable perfectionism. She makes a bolder move than many explicitly feminist commentators on the beauty industry have done, throwing away her beauty products and claiming her time to write rather than primp. Her proposal -- that we figure use our beauty products only when they are a joyful, optional enhancement rather than a burdensome requirement -- is not novel. But she gets the reader to that idea in a series of personal, persuasive essays about her own experience getting to that point, and it is a pleasure to follow her on her journey.
